Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)
Abandoned

This feature is intentionally not enabled because the last time we turned it on, it broke things.  Presumably you've debugged that and made sure that it works in all cases?  Including cases where no PCIeSlots exist?

It should also be noted, this schema is pretty likely to be deprecated by DMTF shortly, so I'm not sure I see the value in having it on OpenBMC.

> This feature is intentionally not enabled because the last time we turned it on, it broke things.  Presumably you've debugged that and made sure that it works in all cases?  Including cases where no PCIeSlots exist?

Yes, I tested it, If PCIeSLots does not exist:
```
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "1",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": []
}
```

> 
> It should also be noted, this schema is pretty likely to be deprecated by DMTF shortly, so I'm not sure I see the value in having it on OpenBMC.

At least for now, it's DMTF compliant, and there are customers using it, so let's go on.

> At least for now, it's DMTF compliant, and there are customers using it, so let's go on.

I'm not understanding.  Per the latest wording of the spec, it's not DMTF compliant.

> Yes, I tested it, If PCIeSLots does not exist:


Is this what broke last time?

> > At least for now, it's DMTF compliant, and there are customers using it, so let's go on.
> 
> I'm not understanding.  Per the latest wording of the spec, it's not DMTF compliant.

I double checked DSP0268_2022.3:
```
6.81 PCIeSlots 1.5.0
```

could you please point out your link?
If you insist, do I need to abandon this change?

> 
> > Yes, I tested it, If PCIeSLots does not exist:
> 
> 
> Is this what broke last time?

yes
Done
Also have https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/60868
Done
What backend did this use in your testing?  Please help to review the backends that are in review that are pushing for this feature.  I wasn't aware any of the backends for this had merged yet.

I know openpower-vpd-parser, pldm has support for pcieSlot and it looks like smbios-mdr  and peci-pcie  do as well. 
https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenbmc+PCIeSlot&type=code
I'll let George answer what backend he is using to test but I suspect it is openpower-vpd-parser and pldm

> I know openpower-vpd-parser, pldm has support for pcieSlot and it looks like smbios-mdr  and peci-pcie  do as well. 
> https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenbmc+PCIeSlot&type=code
> I'll let George answer what backend he is using to test but I suspect it is openpower-vpd-parser and pldm

yes, I use openpower-vpd-parser and pldm
Why undo this change?

> Why undo this change?

When I resolved the conflict, here was the wrong change.
Can we use urlFromPieces here too?
Done

What is the long term plan here for PCIe Slots ?
I know Lakshmi was poking at the new Redfish models that have the slot as part of the Device.  
https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/855566794994221117/1091083305417457685

@Guunar, @Ed
Any more comments on this one?
It is hard to deprecate schemas. I think we should hold off on this, come up with some plan for the new slot as part of the pcie device and work on that (DMTF's new modeling).
